column4: The Ubuntu 10.04 live cd is unable to boot on my PC. You get a misformed X11 splash screen followed by a message saying that an unrecoverable error occurred. Any ideas?
What hardware? Try booting with nomodeset
- It's a self-build (mostly), nothing unusual. All of the hardware worked fine with 9.10. What does the nomodeset option do?
What graphics?
- Something nvidia based... not too old, not too new
Upgrade or new install?
- It would be a new Ubuntu install if I could get the CD to boot
Do you have the closed nvidia drivers installed? Post upgrade I think some people have had to install
- Nvidia-settings on 9.10 says it's a Geforce 6200LE
I'd reinstall the nvidia drivers - take them out, but them back?
- They're installed on the 9.10 version, but since the CD doesn't boot sucesfully I cant do anything
What error are you getting on the CD?
- It just says an unrecoverable error occured and that i'll be dropped to a desktop... which doesnt happen.
Curious - tried another burn of the CD?
- Nope, but the same happened on beta 2... i hoped it would be fixed by now
Oh, more interesting
tried the server/alternate CD?
- Not yet, connection here isn't up to downloading another CD, will have to wait
You could try booting and trying to remove splash/quiet from the boot line and see if there is any smoking gun
- WIll have a go at tweaking the options but i've got the feeling this release has pushed it over the edge... one regression too many
The biggest change on this version is the plymouth boot stuff and also KMS kernel mode switching; booting with nomodeset will stop the second I think
- Got to go, thanks for the help. :)
